page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY (SITES).
page.content: 1. Binchester Roman Fort (Vinovia). Just off the B.Auckland to Newfield road in the S.W. corner of block0420_ 0531 lies the Roman fort of Vinovium. This fort was built by Julius Agricola during his northern campaigns A.D.79_ 84, and remained in intermittant use until the 5thC. Garrisoned originally to protect the important Roman road of Dere Street_part of which can be seen excavated in the fort_ archaeological evidence now points to a changing role Of particular interest is the well_ preserved and exstensive hypocaust now covered by a timber_framed building. Much of this site remains unexcavated. 2. Westerton Folly. Looking rather like a watchtower,it was built by Thomas Wright in 1811. He did not live to finish it, but never_ theless is a conspicuous landmark for many miles around.
